Package algorithms.cycles

Class SimpleCycle_Anyk_Iterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.cycles.SimpleCycle_Anyk_Iterator
  • public class SimpleCycle_Anyk_Iterator
extends Object
    A ranked enumeration algorithm for a conjunctive query that is a simple cycle of binary relations specified by a SimpleCycle_Equijoin_Query object. It is implemented as an iterator that is first initialized and then the method get_next() returns the next best output Tuple in ranked order.

    This class uses a decomposition for the cycle that is based on the submodular width. Instead of the cyclic query, it solves a union of (larger) acylic queries that produces the same output. The input tuples are routed to the appropriate acyclic queries based on a threshold value that determines if they are "heavy" or "light".

    CAUTION: Currently only works for even-length cycles!!
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      String anyk_alg
      The algorithm to be used for any-k enumeration on the acyclic (path) queries.

      Type of heap to be used by the Anyk-Part variants.
      List<Relation> input_relations
      The relations that form the cycle.
      private DP_Anyk_Iterator last_iterator
      Keeps track of which iterator was used in the last call of get_next() so that we know how to refill the empty spot.
      private Relation output
      The relation that output tuples use as a reference.
      private PriorityQueue<org.javatuples.Pair<DP_Solution,​DP_Anyk_Iterator>> pq
      A top-level priority queue that compares the solutions between the different acyclic queries of the decomposition.
      private double threshold
      The numerical value used by the decomposition to differentiate between "heavy" and "light".

      • SimpleCycle_Anyk_Iterator

        public SimpleCycle_Anyk_Iterator​(SimpleCycle_Equijoin_Query query,
                                 String algorithm,
                                 String heap_type)
        Inserts a relation to the path (on the right).
        Parameters:
        query - A simple-cycle conjunctive query.
        algorithm - An any-k algorithm for the acyclic cases.
        heap_type - A string that specifies the type of heap used by the Any-k Part variants.

    • Method Detail

      • get_next

        public Tuple get_next()
        Computes the next output Tuple of SimpleCycle_Equijoin_Query in ranked order. Ties are broken arbitrarily.
        Returns:
        Tuple The next best tuple or null if there are no other tuple.

      • decompose_heavy_light

        private List<Path_Equijoin_Query> decompose_heavy_light()
        Decomposes the cyclic query into a union of acyclic queries. The decomposition is done based on a threshold value such that the produced queries have (input) size determined by the submodular width of the query. For simple cycles, the produced queries are always paths.
        Returns:
        List A list of acyclic queries as the result of the decomposition.

      • carry_through_join

        private Path_Equijoin_Query carry_through_join​(List<Relation> relations)
        Instantiates a particular tree decomposition of the cycle as a new query. This tree decomposition "breaks" the cycle at some attribute, unfolding it into a path. The "breakpoint" attribute is then carried through to all relations. The method assumes that the first attribute of the first relation is the breakpoint. Used by the submodular-width decompositions for the "heavy attributes" (which will be the breakpoint).
        Parameters:
        relations - A list of relations that will be decomposed by this method.
        Returns:
        Path_Equijoin_Query A tree decomposition as a new query.

      • split_join

        private Path_Equijoin_Query split_join​(List<Relation> relations)
        Instantiates a particular tree decomposition of the cycle as a new query. This tree decomposition "splits" the cycle into two and creates two bags. Used by the submodular-width decompositions when all the attributes are "light".
        Parameters:
        relations - A list of relations that will be decomposed by this method.
        Returns:
        Path_Equijoin_Query A tree decomposition as a new query.

      • simple_join

        private Relation simple_join​(List<Relation> relations,
                             String outName)
        Performs the join of binary relations in a path. Called by split_join(java.util.List<entities.Relation>).
        Parameters:
        relations - The input relations that will be joined.
        outName - The name of the output relation.
        Returns:
        Relation The output relation of the join.
